data.quote: Security is a kind of death.
data.author: Tennessee Williams

data.quote: Without danger we cannot get beyond danger.... Each one of us requires the spur of insecurity to force us to do our best.
data.author: Dr. Harold W. Dodds

data.quote: Nerves provide me with energy. ... It's when I don't have them  when I feel at ease  that I get worried.

data.quote: Protection and security are only valuable if they do not cramp life excessively.

data.quote: Too many people are thinking of security instead of opportunity  they seem more afraid of life than of death.

data.quote: The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear-fear of the unknown  the complex  the inexplicable. What he wants beyond everything else is safety.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: We spend our time searching for security and hate it when we get it.
data.author: John Steinbeck

data.quote: Be like the bird that  passing on her flight awhile on boughs too slight  feels them give way beneath her  and yet sings  knowing that she hath wings.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: We hear of a silent generation  more concerned with security than integrity  with conforming than performing  with imitating than creating.
data.author: Thomas J. Watson

data.quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: An old man concludeth from his knowing mankind that they know him too  and that maketh him very wary.
data.author: Lord Halifax

data.quote: A sick man that gets talking about himself  a woman that gets talking about her baby  and an author that begins reading out of his own book  never know when to stop.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: Each man must look to himself to teach him the meaning of life. It is not something discovered  it is something moulded.

data.quote: Egotism: the art of seeing in yourself what others cannot see.
data.author: George Higgins

data.quote: Every one is bound to bear patiently the results of his own example.
data.author: Phaedrus

data.quote: He who is in love with himself has at least this advantage he won't encounter many rivals.
data.author: G. C. Lichtenberg

data.quote: If you can't bite  don't show your teeth.
data.author: Old saying

data.quote: Know him  know me.
data.author: Dizzy Gillespie

data.quote: Man who man would be  must rule the empire of himself.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: No man does anything from a single motive.
data.author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

data.quote: Nobody can honestly think of himself as a strong character because  however successful he may be in overcoming them  he is necessarily aware of the doubts and temptations that accompany every important choice.
data.author: W. H. Auden

data.quote: We carry with us the wonders we seek without us.
data.author: Sir Thomas Browne

data.quote: What the collective age wants  allows and approves  is the perpetual holiday from the self.
data.author: Thomas Mann

data.quote: When a man is wrapped up in himself he makes a pretty small package.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: Who's not sat tense before his own heart's curtain?

data.quote: If a man really knew himself he would utterly despise the ignorant notions others might form on a subject in which he had such matchless opportunities for observation.

data.quote: With every physical pain  my moral fibre unravels a little.
data.author: Mason Cooley

data.quote: I have never seen a greater monster or miracle in the world than myself.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: We are all serving a life sentence in the dungeon of self.

data.quote: One may understand the cosmos  but never the ego  the self is more distant than any star.
data.author: G. K. Chesterton

data.quote: We judge ourselves by our motives and others by their actions.

data.quote: There is nothing noble about being superior to some other man. The true nobility is in being superior to your previous self.
data.author: Hindu proverb

data.quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.

data.quote: Never to talk of oneself is a form of hypocrisy.

data.quote: Be yourself. Who else is better qualified?

data.quote: I don't think anyone is free - one creates one's own prison.

data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: I am as bad as the worst  but  thank God  I am as good as the best.

data.quote: A man can stand a lot as long as he can stand himself. He can live without hope  without friends  without books  even without music  as long as he can listen to his own thoughts.

data.quote: If I am not for myself  who will be?

data.quote: The greatest success is successful self-acceptance.

data.quote: Self-respect is the root of discipline: the sense of dignity grows with the ability to say no to oneself.
data.author: Abraham J. Heschel

data.quote: If you know nothing  be pleased to know nothing.

data.quote: I am more afraid of my own heart than of the Pope and all his cardinals. I have within me the great Pope  Self.

data.quote: The happy man is he who knows his limitations  yet bows to no false gods.

data.quote: From without  no wonderful effect is wrought within ourselves  unless some interior  responding wonder meets it.

data.quote: Nobody knows what's in him until he tries to pull it out. If there's nothing  or very little  the shock can kill a man.

data.quote: Blessed are they who heal us of self-despisings. Of all services which can be done to man  I know of none more precious.

data.quote: When three people call you an ass  put on a bridle.

data.quote: A show of envy is an insult to oneself.

data.quote: Maturity consists of no longer being taken in by oneself.
data.author: Kajetan von Schlaggenberg

data.quote: Our own interests are still an exquisite means for dazzling our eyes agreeably.
data.author: Blaise Pascal

data.quote: To penetrate one's being  one must go armed to the teeth.

data.quote: Men at some time are masters of their fates: The fault  dear Brutus  is not in our stars  But in ourselves  that we are underlings.

data.quote: The important thing is not what they think of me  it is what I think of them.

data.quote: O wad some Pow'r the giftie gie us To see oursels as others see us. It wad frae money a blunder free us  And foolish notion.

data.quote: Self-command is the main elegance.

data.quote: I live in the crowds of jollity  not so much to enjoy company as to shun myself.

data.quote: There is no crime of which I do not deem myself capable.

data.quote: I have been a selfish being all my life  in practice  though not in principle.

data.quote: God knows  I'm no the thing I should be  Nor am I even the thing I could be.
data.author: Robert Burns

data.quote: In the main it is not by introspection but by reflecting on our living in common with others that we come to know ourselves. What is revealed? It is an original creation. data.author: Bernard Lonergan

data.quote: I'm a vague  conjunctured personality  more made up of opinions and academic prepossessions than of human traits and red corpuscles.

data.quote: to be nobody but yourself- in a world which is doing its best  night and day  to make you everybody else - means to fight the hardest battle which any human being can fight  and never stop fighting.
data.author: e. e. cummings

data.quote: Learn what you are  and be such.

data.quote: My great mistake  the fault for which I can't forgive myself  is that one day I ceased my obstinate pursuit of my own individuality.

data.quote: A man must learn to forgive himself.

data.quote: I have come back again to where I belong  not an enchanted place  but the walls are strong.

data.quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.

data.quote: Confronted by an absolutely infuriating review  it is sometimes helpful for the victim to do a little personal research on the critic. When moved to lyricism  does he write "I had a fun time"? Was he ever arrested for burglary? I don't know that you will prove anything this way  but it is perfectly harmless and quite soothing.

data.quote: You can enjoy encouragement coming from outside  but you cannot need for it to come from outside.

data.quote: Next to God we are indebted to women  first for life itself  and then for making it worth living.

data.quote: I am not belittling the brave pioneer men but the sunbonnet as well as the sombrero has helped to settle this glorious land of ours.

data.quote: Next to genius is the power of feeling where true genius lies.

data.quote: Everybody is talented  original  and has something important to say.

data.quote: Cherish forever what makes you unique  'cuz you're really a yawn if it goes!

data.quote: Children see things very well sometimes-and idealists even better.

data.quote: Art is the signature of civilizations.

data.quote: Every single one of us can do things that no one else can do-can love things that no one else can love. We are like violins. We can be used for doorstops  or we can make music.

data.quote: Love your self's self where it lives.

data.quote: Who I am is the best I can be.

data.quote: Oh  I'm so inadequate. And I love myself!

data.quote: Learn what you are and be such.

data.quote: What thou art  that thou art.

data.quote: I is who I is.

data.quote: Best be yourself  imperial  plain  and true!

data.quote: Do not wish to be anything but what you are.

data.quote: Every man must at last accept himself for his portion  and learn to do his work with the tools and talents with which he has been endowed.

data.quote: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.

data.quote: Of all our infirmities  the most savage is to despise our being.

data.quote: Our entire life ... consists ultimately in accepting ourselves as we are.

data.quote: The secret of my success is that at an early age I discovered I was not God.

data.quote: To find the good life you must become yourself.

data.quote: Be content with what you are  and wish not change  nor dread your last day  nor long for it.
data.author: Martial

data.quote: We expect more of ourselves than we have any right to.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

data.quote: I think knowing what you cannot do is more important than knowing what you can.
data.author: Lucille Ball

data.quote: Try as hard as we may for perfection  the net result of our labors is an amazing variety of imperfectness. We are surprised at our own versatility in being able to fail in so many different ways.
data.author: Samuel McChord Crothers

data.quote: Most of us have trouble juggling. The woman who says she doesn't is someone whom I admire but have never met.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: A sobering thought: what if  right at this very moment  I am living up to my full potential?
data.author: Jane Wagner

data.quote: Do not lose courage in considering your own imperfections.
data.author: Saint Francis de Sales

data.quote: We set up harsh and unkind rules against ourselves. No one is born without faults. That man is best who has fewest.
data.author: Horace

data.quote: One must not hope to be more than one can be.
data.author: Nicolas de Chamfort

data.quote: I long to see everything  to know everything  to learn everything!
data.author: Marie Bashkirtseff

data.quote: I can't write a book commensurate with Shakespeare  but I can write a book by me.
data.author: Sir Walter Raleigh

data.quote: I have done what I could do in life  and if I could not do better  I did not deserve it. In vain I have tried to step beyond what bound me.
data.author: Maurice Maeterlinck

data.quote: Don't try to teach a whole course in one lesson.
data.author: Kathryn Murray

data.quote: The man with insight enough to admit his limitations comes nearest to perfection.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: Growth begins when we start to accept our own weakness.
data.author: Jean Vanier

data.quote: To dream of the person you would like to be is to waste the person you are.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Shall a man go and hang himself because he belongs to the race of pygmies  and not be the biggest pygmy that he can?
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Of all the young men in America only a few hundred can get into major league baseball  and of these only a handful in a decade can get into the Hall of Fame. So it goes in all human activity. ... Some become multimillionaires and chairmen of the board  and some of us must be content to play baseball at company picnics or manage a credit union without pay.
data.author: William Feather

data.quote: At thirty a man should know himself like the palm of his hand  know the exact number of his defects and qualities. ... And above all  accept these things.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: You can't make the Duchess of Windsor into Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm. The facts of life are very stubborn things.
data.author: Cleveland Amory

data.quote: Learn to ... be what you are  and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
data.author: Henri Frederic Amiel

data.quote: We cannot all be masters.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: No man can climb out beyond the limitations of his own character.
data.author: John Morley

data.quote: Sometimes it is more important to discover what one cannot do  than what one can do.
data.author: Lin Yutang

data.quote: To do all that one is able to do is to be a man  to do all that one would like to do is to be a god.
data.author: Napoleon Bonaparte

data.quote: No one is expected to achieve the impossible.
data.author: French proverb

data.quote: A hero is a man who does what he can.
data.author: Romain Rolland

data.quote: It is only fools who keep straining at high C all their lives.
data.author: Charles Dudley Warner

data.quote: May God ... let me strive for attainable things.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Despair is the price one pays for setting himself an impossible aim.
data.author: Graham Greene

data.quote: We would have to settle for the elegant goal of becoming ourselves.
data.author: William Styron

data.quote: A great obstacle to happiness is to expect too much happiness.
data.author: Bernard de Fontenelle

data.quote: I cannot do everything  but still I can do something  and because I cannot do everything  I will not refuse to do something I can do.
data.author: Edward Everett Hale

data.quote: I hope to work  support my children and die quietly without pain.
data.author: Sean Connery

data.quote: As we advance in life  we learn the limits of our abilities.
data.author: J. A. Froude

data.quote: Striving for excellence motivates you  striving for perfection is demoralizing.
data.author: Dr. Harriet Braiker

data.quote: There is a proper balance between not asking enough of oneself and asking or expecting too much.
data.author: May Sarton

data.quote: It is enough that I am of value to somebody today.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: A tomb now suffices him for whom the whole world was not sufficient.
data.author: Alexander the Great

data.quote: To wish to act like angels while we are still in this world is nothing but folly.
data.author: Teresa of Avila

data.quote: It isn't important to come out on top  what matters is to be the one who comes out alive.
data.author: Bertolt Brecht

data.quote: I long to accomplish a great and noble task  but it my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: The one important thing I have learned over the years is the difference between taking one's work seriously and taking one's self seriously. The first is imperative and the second is disastrous.
data.author: Margaret Fontey

data.quote: Friendship with oneself is all-important  because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: How I relate to my inner self influences my relationships with all others. My satisfaction with myself and my satisfaction with other people are directly proportional.
data.author: Sue Atchley Ebaugh

data.quote: I was always looking outside myself for strength and confidence  but it comes from within. It is there all the time.
data.author: Anna Freud

data.quote: If you want to be respected by others  the great thing is to respect yourself.
data.author: Fyodor Dostoyevsky

data.quote: If one is cruel to himself  how can we expect him to be compassionate with others?
data.author: Hasdai Ibn Shaprut

data.quote: Let a man's talents or virtues be what they may  he will only feel satisfaction in his society as he is satisfied in himself.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: To succeed is nothing-it's an accident. But to feel no doubts about oneself is something very different: it is character.
data.author: Marie Leneru

data.quote: No matter what age you are  or what your circumstances might be  you are special  and you still have something unique to offer. Your life  because of who you are  has meaning.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: The worst walls are never the ones you find in your way. The worst walls are the ones you put there- you build yourself. Those are the high ones  the thick ones  the ones with no doors in.
data.author: Ursula K. LeGuin

data.quote: Interest in the lives of others  the high evaluation of these lives  what are they but the overflow of the interest a man finds in himself  the value he attributes to his own being?
data.author: Sherwood Anderson

data.quote: I want to be remembered as the person who helped us restore faith in ourselves.
data.author: Wilma Pearl Mankiller

data.quote: Those people who are uncomfortable in themselves are disagreeable to others.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Self-love is not opposed to the love of other people. You cannot really love yourself and do yourself a favor without doing other people a favor  and vice versa.
data.author: Dr. Karl Menninger

data.quote: Healthy personalities accept themselves not in any self-idolizing way  but in the sense that they see themselves as persons who are worth giving to another and worthy to receive from another.
data.author: William Klassen

data.quote: We should try to bring to any power what we have as women. We will destroy it all if we try to imitate that absolutely unfeeling  driving ambition that we have seen coming at us across the desk.
data.author: Colleen Dewhurst

data.quote: A man needs self-acceptance or he can't live with himself  he needs self-criticism or others can't live with him.
data.author: James A. Pike

data.quote: Nobody holds a good opinion of a man who has a low opinion of himself.
data.author: Anthony Trollope

data.quote: To love others  we must first learn to love ourselves.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: There is overwhelming evidence that the higher the level of self-esteem  the more likely one will treat others with respect  kindness  and generosity. People who do not experience self-love have little or no capacity to love others.
data.author: Nathaniel Branden

data.quote: You grow up the day you have your first real laugh at yourself.
data.author: Ethel Barrymore

data.quote: Imagination was given to us to compensate for what we are not  a sense of humor was provided to console us for what we are.
data.author: Mack McGinnis

data.quote: It is the duty of youth to bring its fresh powers to bear on social progress. Each generation of young people should be to the world like a vast reserve force to a tired army. They should lift the world forward. That is what they are for.
data.author: Charlotte P. Gilman

data.quote: I looked always outside of myself to see what I could make the world give me instead of looking within myself to see what was there.
data.author: Belle Livingstone

data.quote: A true man never frets about his place in the world  but just slides into it by the gravitation of his nature  and swings there as easily as a star.
data.author: Edwin H. Chapin

data.quote: My recipe for life is not being afraid of myself  afraid of what I think or of my opinions.
data.author: Eartha Kitt

data.quote: Accept the place the divine providence has found for you.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I needed to find my way to write. I need about six hours of uninterrupted time in order to produce about two hours of writing  and when I accepted that and found the way to do it  then I was able to write.
data.author: Robert B. Parker

data.quote: When one is pretending the entire body revolts.
data.author: Anais Nin

data.quote: When you affirm your own Tightness in the universe  then you co-operate with others easily and automatically as part of your own nature. You  being yourself  help others be themselves.
data.author: Jane Roberts

data.quote: So prodigal was I of youth  Forgetting I was young  I worshipped dead men for their strength  Forgetting I was strong.
data.author: Vita Sackville-West

data.quote: Life is a very sad piece of buffoonery  because we have ... the need to fool ourselves continuously by the spontaneous creation of a reality ... which  from time to time  reveals itself to be vain and illusory.
data.author: Luigi Pirandello

data.quote: The deepest principle in human nature is the craving to be appreciated.
data.author: William James

data.quote: It's OK if you mess up. You should give yourself a break.
data.author: Billy Joel

data.quote: Who we are never changes. Who we think we are does.
data.author: Mary S. Almanac

data.quote: It is not easy to be sure that being yourself is worth the trouble  but [we do know] it is our sacred duty.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: Each of us has a day ... when he has to accept  finally  the fact that he is a man.
data.author: Jean Anouilh

data.quote: Nature never repeats herself  and the possibilities of one human soul will never be found in another.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: Style is something peculiar to one person  it expresses one personality and one only  it cannot be shared.
data.author: Freya Stark

data.quote: If you put a woman in a man's position  she will be more efficient  but no more kind.
data.author: Fay Weldon

data.quote: Accept your humanness as well as your divinity  totally and without reserve.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: The things we hate about ourselves aren't more real than things we like about ourselves.
data.author: Ellen Goodman

data.quote: Why can a man not act himself  be himself  and think for himself? It seems to me that naturalness alone is power  that a borrowed word is weaker than our own weakness  however small we may be.
data.author: Maria Mitchell

data.quote: Until you make peace with who you are  you'll never be content with what you have.
data.author: Doris Mortman

data.quote: If you make friends with yourself you will never be alone.
data.author: Maxwell Maltz

data.quote: It is a sign of strength  not of weakness  to admit that you don't know all the answers.
data.author: John P. Loughrane

data.quote: The fundamental problem most patients have is an inability to love themselves  having been unloved by others during some crucial part of their lives.
data.author: Bernie S. Siegel

data.quote: Who you are is a necessary step to being who you will be.
data.author: Emmanuel

data.quote: Ultimately  love is self approval.
data.author: Sondra Ray

data.quote: Unless I accept my faults  I will most certainly doubt my virtues.
data.author: Hugh Prather

data.quote: Too many people overvalue what they are not and undervalue what they are.
data.author: Malcolm Forbes

data.quote: If I am not for myself  who is for me? And if I am only for myself  what am I? And if not now  when?
data.author: Hillel

data.quote: Accept your defeats With your head up and your eyes open With the grace of woman  not the grief of a child ...
data.author: Kara DiGiovanna

data.quote: He who despises himself esteems himself as a self-despiser.
data.author: Susan Sontag

data.quote: Your problem is you're ... too busy holding onto your unworthiness.
data.author: Ram Dass

data.quote: Conceit spoils the finest genius. There is not much danger that real talent or goodness will be overlooked long  even if it is  the consciousness of possessing and using it well should satisfy one.
data.author: Louisa May Alcott

data.quote: People in big empty places are likely to behave very much as the gods did on Olympus.
data.author: Edna Ferber

data.quote: What makes humility so desirable is the marvelous thing it does to us  it creates in us a capacity for the closest possible intimacy with God.
data.author: Monica Baldwin

data.quote: Calm self-confidence is as far from conceit as the desire to earn a decent living is remote from greed.
data.author: Channing Pollock

data.quote: Big egos are big shields for lots of empty space.
data.author: Diana Black

data.quote: Self-love  my liege  is not so vile a sin as self-neglecting.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The nice thing about egotists is that they don't talk about other people.
data.author: Lucille S. Harper

data.quote: There is nothing so skillful in its own defense as imperious pride.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: Wounded vanity knows when it is mortally hurt  and limps off the field  piteous  all disguises thrown away. But pride carries its banner to the last  and fast as it is driven from one field unfurls it in another.
data.author: Helen Hunt Jackson

data.quote: In our society those who are in reality superior in intelligence can be accepted by their fellows only if they pretend they are not.
data.author: Marya Mannes

data.quote: It is as proper to have pride in oneself as it is ridiculous to show it to others.
data.author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

data.quote: If a man doesn't delight in himself and the force in him and feel that he and it are wonders  how is all life to become important to him?
data.author: Sherwood Anderson

data.quote: Your father used to say  "Never give away your work. People don't value what they don't have to pay for."
data.author: Nancy Hale

data.quote: Pride ... is the direct appreciation of oneself.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
data.author: Emily Bronte

data.quote: Beware of over-great pleasure in being popular or even beloved.
data.author: Margaret Fuller

data.quote: Soften my hard self-opinionatedness  which time has hardened so exceedingly!
data.author: Gertrude the Great

data.quote: Self-esteem isn't everything  it's just that there's nothing without it.
data.author: Gloria Steinem

data.quote: As soon as you trust yourself  you will know how to live.
data.author: Johann von Goethe

data.quote: It is far more impressive when others discover your good qualities without your help.
data.author: Judith Martin

data.quote: Humility is like underwear  essential but indecent if it shows.
data.author: Helen Nielsen

data.quote: The more important the title  the more self-important the person  the greater the amount of time spent on the Eastern shuttle  the more suspicious the man and the less vitality in the organization.
data.author: Jane O'Reilly

data.quote: I'm glad I never feel important  it does complicate life.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: More people are ruined by victory  I imagine  than by defeat.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Vanity is the quicksand of reason.
data.author: George Sand

data.quote: I was somewhat drunk with what I had done. And I am always one to prefer being sober.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: Our vanity is the constant enemy of our dignity.
data.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: To have that sense of one's intrinsic worth which constitutes self-respect is potentially to have everything.
data.author: Joan Didion

data.quote: It is best to act with confidence  no matter how little right you have to it.
data.author: Lillian Hellman

data.quote: I've always seen myself as a winner  even as a kid. If I hadn't  I just might have gone down the drain a couple of times. I've got something inside of me  peasantlike and stubborn  and I'm in it 'til the end of the race.
data.author: Truman Capote

data.quote: Success doesn't necessarily make you a happy person ... but without the confidence and security that comes from being totally happy  I believe you cannot achieve your true potential and ultimate success.
data.author: Jinger Heath

data.quote: Self-respect will keep a man from being abject when he is in the power of enemies  and will enable him to feel that he may be in the right when the world is against him.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Tis the ignorant who boast.
data.author: Carmen Sylva

data.quote: Being powerful is like being a lady. If you have to tell people you are  you aren't.
data.author: Margaret Thatcher

data.quote: There's one blessing only  the source and cornerstone of beatitude: confidence in self.
data.author: Marcus Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: If arrogance is the heady wine of youth  then humility must be its eternal hangover.
data.author: Helen Van Slyke

data.quote: Conquer but never triumph.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: Only so far as a man believes strongly  mightily  can he act cheerfully  or do anything worth doing.
data.author: Frederick W. Robertson

data.quote: Experience tells you what to do  confidence allows you to do it.
data.author: Stan Smith

data.quote: Your success depends mainly upon what you think of yourself and whether you believe in yourself.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: Success can make you go one of two ways. It can make you a prima donna  or it can smooth the edges  take away the insecurities  let the nice things come out.
data.author: Barbara Walters

data.quote: Humility is attentive patience.
data.author: Simone Weil

data.quote: The man who cannot believe in himself cannot believe in anything else.
data.author: Roy L. Smith

data.quote: A man cannot be comfortable without his own approval.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: Believe that you can whip the enemy  and you have won half the battle.
data.author: General J. E. B. Stuart

data.quote: As is our confidence  so is our capacity.
data.author: William Hazlitt

data.quote: Such to me is the new image of aging  growth in self  and service for all mankind.
data.author: Ethel Percy Andrus

data.quote: The older I get  the greater power I seem to have to help the world  I am like a snowball-the further I am rolled  the more I gain.
data.author: Susan B. Anthony

data.quote: The real evidence of growing older is that things level off in importance.
data.author: Gladys Taber

data.quote: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: Oh  yes. I'd do it all again  the spirit is willing yet  I feel the same desire to do the work but the flesh is weak. It's too bad that our bodies wear out while our interests are just as strong as ever.
data.author: Susan B. Anthony

data.quote: I'm not interested in age. People who tell me their age are silly. You're as old as you feel.
data.author: Elizabeth Arden

data.quote: It is sad to grow old  but nice to ripen.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: Maturity is coming to terms with that other part of yourself.
data.author: Dr. Ruth Tiffany Barnhouse

data.quote: I believe the true function of age is memory. I'm recording as fast as I can.
data.author: Rita Mae Brown

data.quote: A woman's always younger than a man of equal years.
data.author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

data.quote: It is often the case with finer natures  that when the fire of the spirit dies out with increasing age  the power of the intellect is unaltered or increased.
data.author: Margaret Gatty

data.quote: I'm like old wine. They don't bring me out very often  but I'm well preserved.
data.author: Rose Fitzgerald Kennedy

data.quote: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
data.author: Madeleine L'Engle

data.quote: Perhaps middle age is  or should be  a period of shedding shells  the shell of ambition  the shell of material accumulations and possessions  the shell of the ego.
data.author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

data.quote: Age is totally unimportant. The years are really irrelevant. It's how you cope with them.
data.author: Shirley Lord

data.quote: We are always the same age inside.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: There is a fountain of youth: it is your mind  your talents  the creativity you bring to your life and the lives of the people you love. When you learn to tap this source  you will truly have defeated age.
data.author: Sophia Loren

data.quote: I am much younger now than I was at twelve or anyway  less burdened.
data.author: Flannery O'Connor

data.quote: There are no old people nowadays  they are either "wonderful for their age" or dead.
data.author: Mary Pettibone Poole

data.quote: For inside all the weakness of old age  the spirit  God knows  is as mercurial as it ever was.
data.author: May Sarton

data.quote: Age puzzles me. I thought it was a quiet time. My seventies were interesting and fairly serene  but my eighties are passionate. I grow more intense as I age.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: We who are old know that age is more than a disability. It is an intense and varied experience  almost beyond our capacity at times  but something to be carried high.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: Character contributes to beauty. It fortifies a woman as her youth fades. A mode of conduct  a standard of courage  discipline  fortitude and integrity can do a great deal to make a woman beautiful.
data.author: Jacqueline Bisset

data.quote: Be on the alert to recognize your prime at whatever time of your life it may occur.
data.author: Muriel Spark

data.quote: Women may be the one group that grows more radical with age.
data.author: Gloria Steinem

data.quote: So much has been said and sung of beautiful young girls  why doesn't somebody wake up to the beauty of old women?
data.author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

data.quote: Old age is that night of life  as night is the old age of day. Still night is full of magnificence and  for many  it is more brilliant than the day.
data.author: Anne-Sophie Swetchine

data.quote: In youth we learn  in age we understand.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: Change excites me. I am fifty years old. It's when the mind catches up with the body.
data.author: Raquel Welch

data.quote: Don't buy the garbage that you're over the hill at fifty. This country makes such a big thing about age  particularly if you're a woman. What I think is relevant is your experience  what you have to offer. I hope people will recognize that and keep going.
data.author: Molly Yard

data.quote: I refuse to admit that I am more than fifty-two  even if that does make my sons illegitimate.
data.author: Nancy Astor

data.quote: I used to dread getting older because I thought I would not be able to do all the things I wanted to do  but now that I am older I find that I don't want to do them.
data.author: Nancy Astor

data.quote: I am immortal! I know it! I feel it!
data.author: Margaret Witter Fuller

data.quote: Another belief of mine: that everyone else my age is an adult  whereas I am merely in disguise.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: I think your whole life shows in your face and you should be proud of that.
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: Youth is not a time of life  it is a state of mind. You are as old as your doubt  your fear  your despair. The way to keep young is to keep your faith young. Keep your self-confidence young. Keep your hope young.
data.author: Luella F. Phean

data.quote: We Can't Afford to Doubt Ourselves I have become my own version of an optimist. If I can't make it through one door  I'll go through another door-or I'll make a door. Something terrific will come no matter how dark the present.
data.author: Joan Rivers

data.quote: Our doubts are traitors  and make us lose the good we oft might win  by fearing to attempt.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Doubt indulged soon becomes doubt realized.
data.author: Frances Ridley Havergal

data.quote: Kill the snake of doubt in your soul  crush the worms of fear in your heart  and mountains will move out of your way.
data.author: Kate Seredy

data.quote: A man's doubts and fears are his worst enemies.
data.author: William Wrigley

data.quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: I have never been nervous in all my life and I have no patience with people who are. If you know what you are going to do  you have no reason to be nervous. And I knew what I was going to do.
data.author: Mary Garden

data.quote: Our self-conceit sustains  and always must sustain us.
data.author: Samuel Butler

data.quote: Self-distrust is the cause of most of our failures ... they are the weakest  however strong  who have no faith in themselves or their own powers.
data.author: Christian Bovee

data.quote: Faith in oneself ... is the best and safest course.
data.author: Michelangelo

data.quote: Strong people don't need strong leaders.
data.author: Ella Baker

data.quote: Might  could  would-they are contemptible auxiliaries.
data.author: George Eliot

data.quote: You've got to take the initiative and play your game ... confidence makes the difference.
data.author: Chris Evert

data.quote: Shyness is just egotism out of its depth.
data.author: Penelope Keith

data.quote: Self-trust is the first secret of success.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
data.author: Samuel Johnson

data.quote: I felt a comedy ego beginning to grow  which gave me the courage to begin tentatively looking into myself for material.
data.author: Joan Rivers

data.quote: My mother taught me very early to believe I could achieve any accomplishment I wanted to. The first was to walk without braces.
data.author: Wilma Rudolph

data.quote: If there be a faith that can move mountains  it is faith in one's own power.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: They are able because they think they are able.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: Nothing splendid has ever been achieved except by those who dared believe that something inside them was superior to circumstances.
data.author: Bruce Barton

data.quote: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks on great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.
data.author: Cicero

data.quote: One's self-image is very important because if that's in good shape  then you can do anything  or practically anything.
data.author: Sir John Gielgud

data.quote: I've never had a humble opinion in my life. If you're going to have one  why bother to be humble about it?
data.author: Joan Baez

data.quote: They conquer who believe they can.
data.author: John Dryden

data.quote: The big gap between the ability of actors is confidence.
data.author: Kathleen Turner

data.quote: Women who are confident of their abilities are more likely to succeed than those who lack confidence  even though the latter may be much more competent and talented and industrious.
data.author: Dr. Joyce Brothers

data.quote: Search and you will find that at the base and birth of every great business organization was an enthusiast  a man consumed with earnestness of purpose  with confidence in his powers  with faith in the worthwhileness of his endeavors.
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Self-reverence  self-knowledge  self-control. These three alone lead to sovereign power.
data.author: Alfred, Lord Tennyson

data.quote: Optimism is the faith that leads to achievement. Nothing can be done without hope and confidence.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Confidence imparts a wonderful inspiration to its possessor.
data.author: John Milton

data.quote: Great poetry is always written by somebody straining to go beyond what he can do.
data.author: Stephen Spender

data.quote: Immense power is acquired by assuring yourself in your secret reveries that you were born to control affairs.
data.author: Andrew Carnegie

data.quote: If one advances confidently in the direction of his dreams  and endeavors to live the life which he has imagined  he will meet with a success unexpected in common hours.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: Ideal conversation must be an exchange of thought  and not  as many of those who worry about their shortcomings believe  an eloquent exhibition of wit or oratory.

data.quote: In forty hours I shall be in battle  with little information  and on the spur of the moment will have to make the most momentous decisions  but I believe that one's spirit enlarges with responsibility and that  with God's help  I shall make them and make them right.

data.quote: Perhaps I am stronger than I think.

data.quote: You have to take it as it happens  but you should try to make it happen the way you want to take it.
data.author: Old German proverb

data.quote: The winds and waves are always on the side of the ablest navigators.
data.author: Edward Gibbon

data.quote: A life of reaction is a life of slavery  intellectually and spiritually. One must fight for a life of action  not reaction.
data.author: Rita Mae Brown

data.quote: Life is raw material. We are artisans. We can sculpt our existence into something beautiful  or debase it into ugliness. It's in our hands.
data.author: Cathy Better

data.quote: The proverb warns that "You should not bite that hand that feeds you." But maybe you should  if it prevents you from feeding yourself.
data.author: Thomas Szasz

data.quote: If we live good lives  the times are also good. As we are  such are the times.
data.author: Saint Augustine

data.quote: Change and growth take place when a person has risked himself and dares to become involved with experimenting with his own life.
data.author: Herbert Otto

data.quote: They have rights who dare defend them.
data.author: Roger Baldwin

data.quote: Make good use of bad rubbish.
data.author: Elizabeth Beresford

data.quote: Things alter for the worse spontaneously  if they be not altered for the better designedly.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Things don't turn up in this world until somebody turns them up.
data.author: James A. Garfield

data.quote: Is life so wretched? Isn't it rather your hands which are too small  your vision which is muddied? You are the one who must grow up.
data.author: Dag Hammarskjold

data.quote: Some leaders are born women.
data.author: Geraldine Ferraro

data.quote: Be thine own palace  or the world's thy jail.
data.author: John Donne

data.quote: A filly who wants to run will always find a rider.
data.author: Jacques Audiberti

data.quote: Each of us makes his own weather  determines the color of the skies in the emotional universe which he inhabits.
data.author: Fulton J. Sheen

data.quote: Thinking is like loving and dying. Each of us must do it for himself.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: Be yourself and think for yourself  and while your conclusions may not be infallible  they will be nearer right than the conclusions forced upon you.
data.author: Elbert Hubbard

data.quote: Though reading and conversation may furnish us with many ideas of men and things  our own meditation must form our judgement.
data.author: Isaac Watts

data.quote: He who has no opinion of his own  but depends upon the opinion and taste of others  is a slave.
data.author: Friedrich Klopstock

data.quote: How much time he gains who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks  but only at what he does himself  to make it just and holy.
data.author: Marcus Aurelius

data.quote: Let me listen to me and not to them.
data.author: Gertrude Stein

data.quote: The efficient man is the man who thinks for himself.
data.author: Charles W. Eliot

data.quote: Learn to depend upon yourself by doing things in accordance with your own way of thinking.
data.author: Grenville Kleiser

data.quote: If we are not responsible for the thoughts that pass our doors  we are at least responsible for those we admit and entertain.
data.author: Charles B. Newcomb

data.quote: Think wrongly  if you please  but in all cases think for yourself.
data.author: Doris Lessing

data.quote: Each man must for himself alone decide what is right and what is wrong  which course is patriotic and which isn't. You cannot shirk this and be a man. To decide against your conviction is to be an unqualified and excusable traitor  both to yourself and to your country  let men label you as they may.
data.author: Mark Twain

data.quote: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depend upon himself  and not upon other men  has adopted the very best plan for living happily.
data.author: Plato

data.quote: Happiness must be cultivated. It is like character. It is not a thing to be safely let alone for a moment  or it will run to weeds.
data.author: Elizabeth Stuart Phelps

data.quote: We are taught you must blame your father  your sisters  your brothers  the school  the teachers-you can blame anyone  but never blame yourself. It's never your fault. But it's always your fault  because if you want to change  you're the one who has got to change. It's as simple as that  isn't it?
data.author: Katharine Hepburn

data.quote: Discontent is want of self-discipline  it is infirmity of will.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Happiness is a conscious choice  not an automatic response.
data.author: Mildred Barthel

data.quote: The essence of philosophy is that a man should so live that his happiness shall depend as little as possible on external things.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: Most folks are about as happy as they make up their minds to be.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: Happiness is not in our circumstances  but in ourselves. It is not something we see  like a rainbow  or feel  like the heat of a fire. Happiness is something we are.
data.author: John B. Sheerin

data.quote: When I have been unhappy  I have heard an opera ... and it seemed the shrieking of winds  when I am happy  a sparrow's chirp is delicious to me. But it is not the chirp that makes me happy  but I that make it sweet.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: The U.S. Constitution doesn't guarantee happiness  only the pursuit of it. You have to catch up with it yourself.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: To believe that if only we had this or that we would be happy  or to pursue any excessive desire  diverts us from seeing that happiness depends on an adequate self.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Happiness belongs to those who are sufficient unto themselves. For all external sources of happiness and pleasure are  by their very nature  highly uncertain  precarious  ephemeral  and subject to chance.
data.author: Arthur Schopenhauer

data.quote: All times are beautiful for those who maintain joy within them  but there is no happy or favorable time for those with disconsolate or orphaned souls.
data.author: Rosalia Castro

data.quote: Felicity  felicity ... is quaffed out of a golden cup ... the flavour is with you alone  and you can make it as intoxicating as you please.
data.author: Joseph Conrad

data.quote: Some pursue happiness others create it.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: To be obliged to beg our daily happiness from others bespeaks a more lamentable poverty than that of him who begs his daily bread.
data.author: Charles Caleb Colton

data.quote: Man is the artificer of his own happiness.
data.author: Henry David Thoreau

data.quote: To wait for someone else  or to expect someone else to make my life richer  or fuller  or more satisfying  puts me in a constant state of suspension.
data.author: Kathleen Tierney Andrus

data.quote: I am my own heaven and hell!
data.author: J. C. F. von Schiller

data.quote: I am responsible for my own well-being  my own happiness. The choices and decisions I make regarding my life directly influence the quality of my days.
data.author: Kathleen Tierney Andrus

data.quote: If you do not find peace in yourself you will never find it anywhere else.
data.author: Paula A. Bendry

data.quote: To know what you prefer  instead of humbly saying Amen to what the world tells you that you ought to prefer  is to have kept your soul alive.
data.author: Robert Louis Stevenson

data.quote: If people are suffering  then they must look within themselves. ... Happiness is not something ready-made [Buddha] can give you. It comes from your own actions.
data.author: The Dalai Lama

data.quote: Blame yourself if you have no branches or leaves  don't accuse the sun of partiality.
data.author: Chinese proverb

data.quote: The opportunities for enjoyment in your life are limitless. If you feel you are not experiencing enough joy  you have only yourself to blame.
data.author: David E. Bresler

data.quote: Happiness is like time and space-we make and measure it ourselves  it is as fancy  as big  as little  as you please  just a thing of contrasts and comparisons.
data.author: George Du Maurier

data.quote: It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves  and it is not possible to find it elsewhere.
data.author: Agnes Repplier

data.quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: No human being can really understand another  and no one can arrange another's happiness.
data.author: Graham Greene

data.quote: No-one gives joy or sorrow. ... We gather the consequences of our own deeds.
data.author: Garuda Purana

data.quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: The amount of satisfaction you get from life depends largely on your own ingenuity  self-sufficiency  and resourcefulness. People who wait around for life to supply their satisfaction usually find boredom instead.
data.author: Dr. William Menninger

data.quote: Somebody's boring me  I think it's me.
data.author: Dylan Thomas

data.quote: Being bored is an insult to oneself.
data.author: Jules Renard

data.quote: When people are bored  it is primarily with their own selves that they are bored.
data.author: Jules Renard

data.quote: If your daily life seems poor  do not blame it  blame yourself  tell yourself that you are not poet enough to call forth its riches.
data.author: Rainer Maria Rilke

data.quote: Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect.
data.author: Margaret Mitchell

data.quote: One has to handle these negative experiences alone. You can't get help from your friends or family. You're finally alone with it  and you have to come to grips with misfortune and go on.
data.author: Shirley Temple Black

data.quote: Expect nothing. Live frugally on surprise.
data.author: Alice Walker

data.quote: If you want to succeed  you must make your own opportunities as you go.
data.author: John B. Gough

data.quote: It is sometimes the man who opens the door who is the last to enter the room.
data.author: Elizabeth Asquith Bibesco

data.quote: If  after all  men cannot always make history have a meaning  they can always act so that their own lives have one.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: Every man is the architect of his own fortune.
data.author: Sallust

data.quote: A wise man will make more opportunities than he finds.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: Man is still responsible. ... His success lies not with the stars  but with himself. He must carry on the fight of self-correction and discipline.
data.author: Frank Curtis Williams

data.quote: No one can help you in holding a good job except Old Man You.
data.author: Edgar Watson Howe

data.quote: No man will succeed unless he is ready to face and overcome difficulties and prepared to assume responsibilities.
data.author: William J. H. Boetcker

data.quote: The brave man carves out his fortune  and every man is the sum of his own works.
data.author: Miguel de Cervantes

data.quote: Under normal periods  any man's success hinges about 5 percent on what others do for him and 95 percent on what he does.
data.author: James A. Worsham

data.quote: If a man wants his dreams to come true  he must wake up.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Pa  he always said a man had to look spry for himself  because nobody would do it for him  your opportunities didn't come knocking around  you had to hunt them down and hog-tie them.
data.author: Louis L'Amour

data.quote: Destiny is not a matter of chance  it is a matter of choice  it is not a thing to be waited for  it is a thing to be achieved.
data.author: William Jennings Bryan

data.quote: Men at some time are masters of their fates.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: The people who get on in this world are the people who get up and look for the circumstances they want  and  if they can't find them  make them.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Mistakes fail in their mission of helping the person who blames them on the other fellow.
data.author: Henry S. Haskins

data.quote: We have not passed that subtle line between childhood and adulthood until... we have stopped saying "It got lost " and say "I lost it."
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: Do not blame anybody for your mistakes and failures.
data.author: Bernard M. Baruch

data.quote: The day you take complete responsibility for yourself  the day you stop making excuses  that's the day you start your move to the top.
data.author: O. J. Simpson

data.quote: It is a painful thing to look at your own trouble and know that you yourself  and no one else  has made it.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: When you blame others  you give up your power to change.
data.author: Anonymous

data.quote: Take your life in your own hands  and what happens? A terrible thing: no one to blame.
data.author: Erica Jong

data.quote: What fate can be worse than to know we have no one but ourselves to blame for our misfortunes!
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Fair play with others is primarily not blaming them for anything that is wrong with us.
data.author: Eric Hoffer

data.quote: How we love to blame others for our misfortunes! Almost every individual who has lost money in stock speculation has on the tip of his tongue an explanation which he trots out to show that it wasn't his own fault at all.... Hardly one loser has the manliness to say frankly  "I was wrong."
data.author: B. C. Forbes

data.quote: Man must cease attributing his problems to his environment and learn again to exercise ... his personal responsibility in the realm of faith and morals.
data.author: Albert Schweitzer

data.quote: The greatest griefs are those we cause ourselves.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: The fault  dear Brutus  is not in our stars  but in ourselves.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He does not say  "My men were beaten " he says  "I was beaten."
data.author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

data.quote: Debt is a trap which man sets and baits himself  and then deliberately gets into.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: God helps those who help themselves.
data.author: German proverb

data.quote: I feel no need for any other faith than my faith in human beings.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: It is vain to ask of the gods what man is capable of supplying for himself.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: The gods help those who help themselves.
data.author: Marcus Terentius Varro

data.quote: Ask God's blessing on your work  but don't ask him to do it for you.
data.author: Dame Flora Robson

data.quote: He who prays and labours lifts his heart to God with his hands.
data.author: Saint Bernard

data.quote: God gives every bird its food  but he does not throw it into the nest.
data.author: Josiah G. Holland

data.quote: Trust in Allah  but tie your camel first.
data.author: Arab proverb

data.quote: Put your trust in God  my boys  and keep your powder dry!
data.author: Valentine Blacker

data.quote: God loves to help him who strives to help himself.
data.author: Aeschylus

data.quote: Religious faith  indeed  relates to that which is above us  but it must arise from that which is within us.
data.author: Josiah Royce

data.quote: Even God lends a hand to honest boldness.
data.author: Menander

data.quote: Help yourself and heaven will help you.
data.author: Jean de la Fontaine

data.quote: God has entrusted me with myself.
data.author: Epictetus

data.quote: The Ancient Mariner said to Neptune during a great storm  "O God  you will save me if you wish  but I am going to go on holding my tiller straight."
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: If your ship doesn't come in  swim out to it.
data.author: Jonathan Winters

data.quote: To character and success  two things  contradictory as they may seem  must go together-humble dependence and manly independence  humble dependence on God and manly reliance on self.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: I am a moonbeam  free to go whenever I choose.
data.author: Marina Tsvetaeva

data.quote: My will shall shape my future. Whether I fail or succeed shall be no man's doing but my own. I am the force  I can clear any obstacle before me or I can be lost in the maze. My choice  my responsibility  win or lose  only I hold the key to my destiny.
data.author: Elaine Maxwell

data.quote: I had never been as resigned to ready-made ideas as I was to ready-made clothes  perhaps because although I couldn't sew  I could think.
data.author: Jane Rule

data.quote: Self-reliance is the only road to true freedom  and being one's own person is its ultimate reward.
data.author: Patricia Sampson

data.quote: The basic freedom of the world is woman's freedom.
data.author: Margaret Sanger

data.quote: Never grow a wishbone  daughter  where your backbone ought to be.
data.author: Clementine Paddleford

data.quote: You are the handicap you must face. You are the one who must choose your place.
data.author: James Lane Allen

data.quote: The best and most efficient pharmacy is within your own system.
data.author: Robert C. Peale

data.quote: I am the master of my fate  I am the captain of my soul.
data.author: William E. Henley

data.quote: Champions take responsibility. When the ball is coming over the net  you can be sure I want the ball.
data.author: Billie Jean King

data.quote: A man is a lion in his own cause.
data.author: Scottish proverb

data.quote: For they can conquer who believe they can.
data.author: Virgil

data.quote: I have ever held it as a maxim never to do that through another which it was possible for me to execute myself.
data.author: Charles Montesquieu

data.quote: Doubt whom you will  but never yourself.
data.author: Christian Nestell Bovee

data.quote: No man should part with his own individuality and become that of another.
data.author: William Ellery Channing

data.quote: Think wrongly  if you please  but in all cases think for yourself.
data.author: Gotthold E. Lessing

data.quote: Greater love hath no man than this  that a man lay down his life for his friends.
data.author: Bible
